metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25310 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A segmentation fault (SEGV) flaw was found in the Fribidi package and affects the fribidi_remove_bidi_marks() function of the lib/fribidi.c file. This flaw allows an attacker to pass a specially crafted file to Fribidi, leading to a crash and causing a denial of service.

notes.Note: rayveldkamp> For bionic affected function is in fribidi-deprecated.c

criterions.comment: fribidi: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
